intro: Hypocalymma melaleucoides, commonly known as the white-flowered hypocalymma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to the arid regions of Western Australia, where it typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is characterized by its small, white or cream-colored flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It is a shrub that produces small, elliptical leaves with a rough, hairy texture. The species is well adapted to dry conditions, showing features such as reduced leaf size and deep root systems to conserve water.
